intro: Phaedranthus cinerascens, commonly known as the silverleaf phaedranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its soft, silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
